Size: Up to 50 cm above surface of mud or water.
Stem: Short stems branched with leaves, and longer leafless stems with daughter plants at ends.
Leaves: Bright green shiny, thick, leathery, up to 10 cm long, oval or heart-shaped with pointed tip. Young leaves circular disk with spongey underside.
Flowers: White, greenish-white or yellowish, 13 mm long.
FruitSeeds: Fleshy berry-like capsules 4-18 mm long, with up to 200 tiny, bristled seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Larger fruit and pointed tipped leaves compared to Frogbit.
Impacts: Forms large mats affecting water flow and quality, reduces food and habitat for native aquatic species.
